title: Math is Everywhere!
content: Did you know that bees build their honeycombs in hexagons? This shape uses the least amount of wax to hold the most honey!

title: Water Wonder
content: Water can be in three forms: solid (ice), liquid (water), and gas (steam). This is called the water cycle!

title: Butterfly Magic
content: A butterfly tastes with its feet! It has taste sensors on its feet to help find the right plants for laying eggs.

title: Number Fun
content: Zero is the only number that can't be represented in Roman numerals. It was invented in India around the 5th century!

title: Rainbow Science
content: Rainbows are formed when sunlight passes through raindrops. The light bends and separates into different colors!

title: Shapes in Nature
content: Many fruits and vegetables are spheres because this shape allows them to hold the most volume with the least surface area.

title: Animal Superpowers
content: A chameleon's tongue can be twice as long as its body to catch insects from a distance!

title: Space Facts
content: The Sun is so big that about 1.3 million Earths could fit inside it!

title: Plant Secrets
content: Some plants can turn their leaves to follow the Sun throughout the day. This is called heliotropism!

title: Human Body
content: Your nose can remember 50,000 different scents, and your ears never stop growing!
